content:
Zadnja sprememba: anon-10743 10.03.2007 03:03

Crni je
napisal(a):
Lahko zbiras toznike in ze s tem izvajas pritisk na banko. Za class
action dobi tudi cisto vsak oskodovanec v ZDA na dom izjavo, da se
pridruzuje tozbi, ki jo mora podpisati. Torej ravno tako zbirajo
toznike in potem, ko pride do dejanske tozbe ni vec mozno dodajati
toznikov (kolikor jaz vem). Ponavadi se take stvari uredijo z
izvensodno poravnavo.

Class action lawsuit je projekt predvsem za kaksno odvetnisko
pisarno in ne za bredo kutin. Ker se se nobena ni javila, pa ne da
bi v sloveniji manjkalo odvetnikov ki bi radi dobro zasluzili, je
meni ocitno, da se zadeva ne splaca. Ne vem, kaksni so fiksni
stroski ki jih mora pokriti en toznik, a pomisli, ce mora recimo
vsak toznik v sloveniji (izmisljen primer) placati za 10 EUR takse
ali kolekov za kaksno pooblastilo odvetniku, je taksna class action
ze nerentabilna. Torej, ne, ni res, kar pises ti, ti predlagas
zadevo, ki se ji rece "mass action".

Class action se od skupinske tozbe, "mass action", razlikuje ravno
po tem da ima poseben status, saj se imenovani toznik tozi V IMENU
VSEH oskodovancev, tudi v tozbi neimenovanih, razen ce se
eksplicitno ne odpovejo sodelovanju . To je bistveno, in imam
obcutek da je to bistveno lazje v sistemih kjer ima precedencno
pravo vecjo tezo.

Torej, class action v nasem primeru bi recimo izgledala tako, da
jaz grem k odvetniku, in se pozanimam, ali bi me zastopal v class
action proti bankam (tudi obtozencev je lahko vec, npr. vse
slovenske banke ki so uvedle provizije!). Potem greva z odvetnikm
pred sodisce, in sodisce po presoji odloci, ali je primer primeren
za class action. Potem se poslje vsem potencialnim oskodovancem
obvestilo, vendar lahko jaz in odvetnik nadaljujeva s tozbo tudi v
imenu vseh tistih, ki se ne odzovejo! V primeru zmage pa bodo
vseeno dobili svoj denar, tudi ce ne mignejo s prstom.

Razumes kako hudo nekompatibilno je to s pravnim sistemom v
sloveniji?


Can I be bound by a settlement or judgment of a class action?

Yes. If the constitutional and procedural protections required for
fairness are met in the underlying action, all absent class members
are bound to the judgment or settlement of the case. However, if
the action is primarily for compensatory damages, absent class
members are entitled to notice and an opportunity to "opt-out"
(exclude themselves) from the proceedings. If a person opts-out, he
is not bound by any judgment or settlement of the class action. In
the event a class action is for declaratory or injunctive relief,
notice is not required to bind absent class members and the court
may not allow your to opt-out.

How do I join a class action?

A. Generally, before a court certifies a class action, it must
conclude that there are too many class members for them all to be
named as parties in the lawsuit. Technically, class members do
not "join" into the litigation, but decide to participate by not
"opting-out." It is only in rare instances when a suit is filed as
an "opt-in" class action. In those rare instances, a claim form
or request to join form may be necessary. Ordinarily, the notice
issued to class members in the usual suit for compensatory damages
will tell the class if they need to take any action to participate.
In a suit for compensatory damages, any class member who does not
"opt-out" may be bound by the results of the litigation if it
proceeds as a class action. If a class member should determine,
however, that he wants to participate in the suit as a named party,
he may hire his own lawyer and seek to intervene (participate) in
the lawsuit.
